DataElement.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Survival Active Follow-up Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Surv-Date Active Followup is defined as the earlier of the Date of Last Contact [1750] and a study cutoff date.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Follow-up Recurrence Death Survival Active Follow-up Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._To come back or to return._The cessation of life._Continuance of life or existence especially under adverse conditions; includes methods and philosophy of survival._Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:To occur again.:The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
